oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Forrest House rules

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Proprietor C. S. Garrigus outlines the hotel's rules of operation to which guests should adhere.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Announcements; Handbills; Fliers (printed matter)
Broadsides; Lincoln County (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: C. S. Garrigus served as one of the incorporators of the Tyree Springs Petroleum Company, first chartered by Tennessee's 34th General Assembly in 1865-66. The company sought to explore, dig, bore, and mine for petroleum, coal, and minerals, as well as to refine, manufacture, and market those products.
